name: Don't Drop It, Don't Lose It
name_original: Don't Drop It, Don't Lose It
description:
"Good Rodriguez... You finally got it. Now resist until reinforcements arrive. Just remember one thing: DON'T DROP IT. DON'T F*CKING LOSE IT."

This game I made in about one week. I wanted to learn about beat 'em ups and synchronization of animation and game logics. It's still in development, as there are still some bugs in the game, but I think that it's pretty playable as it is now.

I'm a programmer with absolutely no art skills and there was no way I could've created all those models, textures and sounds alone. There is still no "credits" screen, but I will put here where I got each resource:

The warehouse scenario: https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/en/#!/content/3439

The bodyguards models: https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/en/#!/content/31711

The main player: https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/en/#!/content/84232

The food pickups: https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/en/#!/content/85884

The dying sounds: https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/en/#!/content/32785

The ground texture: https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/en/#!/content/70619

The punch sound: https://freesound.org/people/JewTwinz/sounds/244513/

The pickup sound: https://freesound.org/people/Koops/sounds/20281/

All animations: www.mixamo.com

Footstep sound: https://freesound.org/people/Fantozzi/sounds/166299/

Phew! I believe that's all.
